_comment_file_purpose: Example Claude Desktop MCP configuration for Mac. Copy this to: ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json
_comment_security: IMPORTANT: Replace all YOUR_*_HERE placeholders with your actual API keys. Never commit real API keys to git.
_comment_mac_paths: This config uses Mac-specific paths. Filesystem MCP paths should point to your actual project directories.

mcpServers._comment_github: GitHub MCP - Access repositories, create PRs, manage issues. Required: GitHub Personal Access Token with repo scope.

github.description: GitHub operations - repos, PRs, issues, commits

mcpServers._comment_filesystem: Filesystem MCP - Local file access. SECURITY: Only grant access to specific directories you trust.
mcpServers._comment_memory: Memory MCP - Persistent memory across Claude sessions. No API key needed.

memory.description: Persistent memory across sessions - remembers context

mcpServers._comment_notion: Notion MCP - Access Notion databases and pages. Required: Notion Integration Token.

notion.description: Notion workspace integration - read and update pages
notion._setup_instructions: 1. Go to https://www.notion.so/my-integrations 2. Create new integration 3. Copy Internal Integration Token 4. Share relevant pages with the integration

mcpServers._comment_zapier: Zapier MCP - Trigger Zapier workflows and automations. Required: Zapier API Key.

zapier._setup_instructions: 1. Go to https://zapier.com/app/settings/api 2. Create API key 3. Paste here

mcpServers._comment_supabase: Supabase MCP - Database operations for your Supabase project. Required: Project Reference.

supabase._setup_instructions: 1. Go to https://supabase.com/dashboard 2. Open your project 3. Copy project ref from Settings > General 4. Replace YOUR_SUPABASE_PROJECT_REF above

mcpServers._comment_sequential_thinking: Sequential Thinking MCP - Chain-of-thought reasoning. No API key needed.
mcpServers._comment_optional_servers: Below are optional MCP servers you might want to add

_example_brave_search._comment: Brave Search - Web search via Brave API. Uncomment and add API key to enable.
_example_brave_search._description: Web search via Brave Search API

_example_postgres._comment: PostgreSQL - Direct database access. Uncomment and configure connection string to enable.

_example_slack._comment: Slack - Send messages and read channels. Uncomment and add bot token to enable.

_example_google_drive._comment: Google Drive - Access Drive files. Requires OAuth setup.

_config_notes.context_window_warning: ⚠️ Each MCP server consumes context tokens. Keep under 10 active servers to preserve Claude's 200k context window.
_config_notes.token_usage_estimate: 5 servers = ~30k tokens | 10 servers = ~70k tokens | 20 servers = ~130k tokens
_config_notes.how_to_disable: To disable an MCP server without deleting it, add it to disabledMcpServers array in project-level .claude/settings.json
_config_notes.project_specific_config: You can override this global config per-project by creating .claude/claude_desktop_config.json in your project root
_config_notes.restart_required: After editing this file, quit and restart Claude Desktop for changes to take effect
security_tips: Store API keys in macOS Keychain when possible
Never commit this file with real API keys to git
filesystem_security: Only grant access to directories you actively use
Use separate filesystem MCP entries for different security levels
_config_notes.backup_this_file: Keep a backup of this config! Save to: ~/Documents/claude-backup/ or commit (without secrets) to a private repo
